snippet:
9:00 p.m. | Updated 

   
With a $145 billion cash hoard,  Apple  could acquire  Facebook ,  Hewlett-Packard  and  Yahoo . Put another way, it could buy every office building and retail space in New York, according to city estimates.
abstract: Apple raises $17 billion in a record-size bond deal, despite $145 billion cash reserve, to feed investor demand; Apple is plagued by concerns its growth may be slowing, with its shares having plummeted from $700 to under $400 in the past year; company is issuing bonds to help finance a $100 billion payout to shareholders. Photo, Chart (M)

headline.main: To Satisfy Its Investors, Cash-Rich Apple Borrows Money

byline.original: By PETER LATTMAN and PETER EAVIS; Charles V. Bagli contributed reporting

snippet: Hotels are less interested in television hardware than in getting the Internet into every room, and delivering what entertainment the guest may prefer.
abstract: Hotels have reduced spending on television hardware, focusing instead on providing widespread internet access, which allows guests to choose their entertainment; analysts say in future, using Internet for e-mail will be free, while many hotels will charge for uses requiring more bandwidth.

headline.main: In-Room Entertainment Turns Away From TV
headline.print_headline: In-Room Entertainment Turns Away From TV

snippet: Why would a company with $145 billion in cash even bother to issue debt? The answer has a lot to do with the frenzied state of the bond markets.
abstract: Why would a company with $145 billion in cash even bother to issue debt? The answer has a lot to do with the frenzied state of the bond markets.

headline.main: To Satisfy Its Investors, Cash-Rich Apple Borrows Money
headline.print_headline: To Satisfy Its Investors, Cash-Rich Apple Borrows Money

byline.original: By PETER LATTMAN and PETER EAVIS

snippet: You can easily manage your connected Bluetooth devices in the Mac OS X Bluetooth preferences box.
abstract: You can easily manage your connected Bluetooth devices in the Mac OS X Bluetooth preferences box.

snippet: Worries about slower economic growth have rattled the stock market during April, but it has consistently bounced back.
abstract: Stock market moves slightly higher, recovering from an earlier slump, following IBM's announcement that it would buy back more stock and raise its dividend.

snippet: A fresh departure at JPMorgan Chase has heightened concerns about turnover at the bank. | UBS posts strong first-quarter earnings. | An academic study highlights the dark art of leaking deals. | Berlin has transformed from a cold war relic to a fa...
abstract: A fresh departure at JPMorgan Chase has heightened concerns about turnover at the bank. | UBS posts strong first-quarter earnings. | An academic study highlights the dark art of leaking deals. | Berlin has transformed from a cold war relic to a fast-growing start-up community.

snippet: Companies that produce digital content are putting on presentations this week in hopes of attracting advertising dollars from marketers and agencies.
abstract: Stuart Elliott and Tanzina Vega Advertising column; companies that produce digital content like online video and streaming video are putting on presentations as part of 'upfront season,' in which networks and channels preview their 2013-14 lineups for advertisers; producers hope to attract dollars from marketers and agencies, either in diverted television budgets or additive spending.

headline.main: Hoopla of TV, Wooing Ads to Digital Media
headline.print_headline: Hoopla of TV, Wooing Ads to Digital Media

byline.original: By STUART ELLIOTT and TANZINA VEGA

snippet: Ignored in the United States, white asparagus gets its proper respect in France, where it is a herald of spring.
abstract: Elaine Sciolino Letter From Paris column hails qualities of white asparagus; notes that while it is revered in France as spring delight it unfortunately does not garner same respect in United States where green counterpart is favorite; recipe for white asparagus with cashew cream sauce given.

snippet: Technology’s popularity Monday was a change from earlier this month, when it lagged the rest of the market.
abstract: Stocks rise, recovering ground lost in previous two weeks, as technology companies lead Standard & Poor's 500-stock index to new closing high.

headline.main: Tech Companies Lead S.&P. to New High
headline.print_headline: Tech Companies Lead S.&P. to New High

snippet: The promoter of One F.C., based in Singapore, isn’t shy about his dreams: He believes that his fighting league could be the top sport in Asia within 10 years.

headline.main: Mixed Martial Arts Venture Has Big Plans for Asia
headline.print_headline: Mixed Martial Arts Venture Has Big Dreams About Asia
